column1: Accounts and Operations of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka
Unprecedented demand for currency in the first half of 2022

which 
increased 
to  Rs.  1,240  billion 
in  April,  gradually
decreased  in  the  second  half  of  2022.  The  value  of  total
currency in circulation increased by 2.1 per cent and reported
at  Rs.  1,026.0  billion  as  at  31  December  2022,  over  the
previous year, as shown in Table II -3 and Chart II-1.
